intro: Gyrostachys papulosa, commonly known as the roughleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb with distinctive, rough, papery leaves that are often covered in small, raised bumps. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Gyrostachys papulosa is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, resilient species.
